translated: The Dyad on What is not Mental Factor

original: Nacittasamuṭṭhānaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nacittasamuṭṭhāno dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā …. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na citta samuṭṭhānam dhammam paṭicca na citta samuṭṭhānaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a non-mental-factor dhamma as condition, a non-mental-factor dhamma arises by way of root-cause condition … (abbreviated) …

original: Hetuyā nava …pe… adhipatiyā pañca …pe… purejāte āsevane pañca …pe… avigate nava.
analyzed: hetuyā nava pe adhipatiyā pañca pe purejāte āsevane pañca pe avigate nava
translated: In the case of root-cause, there are nine; … in the case of predominance, five; … in the case of prior, and in the case of post, five; … in the case of dissociation, nine.
